channel.title: Searching an experienced Developer
channel.description:
[b]Sup mopar! I've decided to recruit again.[/b]
Currently we're [b]2 Developers[/b] and [b]1 Co Owner[/b]
Developers : *Fixed Some things ^^
[s][b]- Vendetta[/b] [i][DEMOTED/DELETED][/i][/s] [b]- Sh0ck[/b] [i][Main owner][/i] [b]- Docey [/b][i][Co owner ][/i]
I did released my Project at 'Server Development' Thread: http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,636030.0.html Check the thread out so you can see the pictures.
No application needed. We dont recruit people under 15. Skype is recommended
[b]Add me Skype:[/b]
[b]yasinouha [/b] [i]-- I will introduce you to the other.[/i]
*Please note that other people may pm me too for developer.
[b]Current forums :[/b] [url=http://www.soulplanet.smffy.com/]http://www.soulplanet.smffy.com/[/url]

item.title: Searching an experienced Developer
item.dc:creator: @tigerclan tigerclan
item.description:
@tigerclan wrote:

[quote=“xXSh0ckXx, post:10, topic:518048”][quote author=kidgoku4522 link=topic=636311.msg4291031#msg4291031 date=1367240142]
#C or C++ is harder So yea don’t go to conclusions
[/quote]
Rofl we’re talking about java here not about C++ Or anything related to that C shit[/quote]

Java is not a “hard program language”. The syntax is simple and there’s a giant amount of information online because of the amount of developers who know java. And being a musician and a developer I can tell you first hand that music can be pretty complex. And also Cruel Truth I never said I was stating any facts, I told Shock that he has no evidence to back up his statements and “generally” musicians that start at a younger age or better.

Read full topic

item.title: Searching an experienced Developer
item.dc:creator: @xXSh0ckXx xXSh0ckXx
item.description:
@xXSh0ckXx wrote:

[quote=“tigerclan, post:5, topic:518048”][quote author=Cruel Truth link=topic=636311.msg4290321#msg4290321 date=1367094979]

No application needed. We dont recruit people under 15.

LOL.
[/quote]not sure why your laughing out loud about that statement. While we do have programmers on the site who are under that age the truth is they still don’t understand how to develop very advanced java methods. As I stated on another thread a while back a person can understand java but they won’t REALLY understand java until it just clicks one day. It’s sort of like algebra.

That’s a ridiculous statement with no evidence to support it. Everyone knows that children can learn much quicker than an adult can, which is generally why musicians that start at a younger age will be better.[/quote]

Yeah sure, but dont compare java with music. Java is a hard program language. And its totally impossible that children can say that they’re ‘Experienced’ in java. And i totally agree Cruel truth, they would understand the basics but not the advanced way of java. Thats for what im looking for. I need an EXPERIENCED Developer who knows how to program the Advanced way of java. The most children try to understand java, but they are NOT able to do that. They will never understand java till they have reached an appropriate age. This would answer everything here.

Read full topic

item.title: Searching an experienced Developer
item.dc:creator: @Cruel_Truth Cruel Truth
item.description:
@Cruel_Truth wrote:

[quote=“tigerclan, post:5, topic:518048”][quote author=Cruel Truth link=topic=636311.msg4290321#msg4290321 date=1367094979]

No application needed. We dont recruit people under 15.

LOL.
[/quote]not sure why your laughing out loud about that statement. While we do have programmers on the site who are under that age the truth is they still don’t understand how to develop very advanced java methods. As I stated on another thread a while back a person can understand java but they won’t REALLY understand java until it just clicks one day. It’s sort of like algebra.

That’s a ridiculous statement with no evidence to support it. Everyone knows that children can learn much quicker than an adult can, which is generally why musicians that start at a younger age will be better.[/quote]considering plasticity ends around 2nd-third grade that statement is false.

Read full topic
